summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys Mariann Wang and Gloria Allred, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney, discussing the scheduling of interviews for multiple clients who are potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails contain summaries of the clients' allegations, including timeframes, locations, and interactions with Epstein, Maxwell, and others, including Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney at Cuti Hecker Wang LLP, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule victim interviews and request information about evidence, such as photographs.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney at Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, co-counsel with Mariann Wang, involved in coordinating victim interviews with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, the primary point of contact for the attorneys regarding victim interviews and evidence requests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker; the subject of the investigation. Multiple clients allege abuse by him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, accused of facilitating abuse. Mentioned in the context of leaving voicemails for a victim and interacting with multiple clients.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: British royal; mentioned in the context of a final interaction with a victim at Epstein's townhouse in 2010.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred, who sent a Zoom conference link for a scheduled call.

connections.description: Co-counsels representing multiple clients who are potential victims of Epstein and Maxwell.
Attorney corresponding with an Assistant U.S. Attorney to schedule victim interviews and discuss case evidence.
Attorney corresponding with an Assistant U.S. Attorney to coordinate on victim interviews for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
Maxwell is described as interacting with and leaving messages for victims, acting in association with Epstein.
Prince Andrew was present during a victim's final interaction with Epstein at his townhouse in 2010.
Implied connection through mutual association with Jeffrey Epstein, though not directly stated in this document.

events.title: Scheduled Zoom Call with AUSA
events.description: A Zoom call was scheduled between attorneys Mariann Wang, Gloria Allred, and Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene to discuss questions prior to scheduling victim interviews.

events.title: Scheduled Client Interviews
events.description: A date proposed for interviewing clients whose sessions had been adjourned a few weeks prior.

events.title: Alleged Incident in New York
events.description: A client (initials AR) alleges one incident of abuse by Epstein in New York in 2002.

events.title: Multiple Alleged Incidents in NY and FL
events.description: A client (initials JRC) alleges multiple incidents of abuse by Epstein in New York from fall 2003 to late 2004, with some interactions involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Final Interaction with Epstein and Prince Andrew
events.description: A client (initials AR) alleges a final interaction with Epstein that included an interaction with Prince Andrew at Epstein's townhouse.

events.title: Alleged Incidents in Paris and Florida
events.description: A client (initials DM) alleges multiple incidents in Paris and Florida from August to November 2017, interacting with others working for Epstein.

locations: Southern District of New York (1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007)
keyFacts: Attorneys Mariann Wang and Gloria Allred were representing multiple clients alleging abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell and were coordinating their interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office in 2020.
One victim allegation includes a 2010 interaction with Epstein that also involved Prince Andrew at Epstein's townhouse.
The emails reference a need for clarification from prosecutors regarding 'photographs' before informing clients, indicating the existence of photographic evidence in the case.
Victim allegations span from approximately 2000 to 2017 and occur in multiple locations including New York, Florida, Paris, California, and Washington, D.C.
Ghislaine Maxwell is specifically mentioned in the context of leaving voicemails for a victim and interacting with multiple clients.
